data.name: Pineco
data.flavorText: It spits out a fluid that it uses to glue tree bark to its body. The fluid hardens when it touches air.

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Gogoat
data.flavorText: It can sense the feelings of others by touching them with its horns. This species has assisted people with their work since 5,000 years ago.

attacks.name: Rising Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Arboliva
data.flavorText: This calm Pokémon is very compassionate. It will share its delicious, nutrient-rich oil with weakened Pokémon.

abilities.name: Enriching Oil
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may heal all damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

data.name: Vivillon
data.flavorText: This Pokémon was born in a land where flowers bloom. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.

attacks.name: Miracle Powder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a Special Condition. Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now affected by that Special Condition.

data.name: Toedscruel
data.flavorText: It coils its 10 tentacles around prey and sucks out their nutrients, causing the prey pain. The folds along the rim of its head are a popular delicacy.

attacks.name: Eerie Tentacles
attacks.text: You may move an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon to 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Triple Smash
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 80 damage for each heads.

data.name: Spewpa
data.flavorText: Spewpa doesn't live in a fixed location. It roams where it pleases across the fields and mountains, building up the energy it needs to evolve.

abilities.name: Adaptive Evolution
abilities.text: This Pokémon can evolve during your first turn or the turn you play it.

data.name: Scovillain
data.flavorText: The green head has turned vicious due to the spicy chemicals stimulating its brain. Once it goes on a rampage, there is no stopping it.

attacks.name: Hot Bite
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Super Spicy Breath
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Fire Energy attached, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Clauncher
data.flavorText: Clauncher's claws will regrow if they fall off. The meat inside the claws is edible, but it has a distinct flavor that doesn't appeal to all tastes.

data.name: Quaquaval
data.flavorText: A single kick from a Quaquaval can send a truck rolling. This Pokémon uses its powerful legs to perform striking dances from far-off lands.

abilities.name: Energy Carnival
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may attach a Basic Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

data.name: Alomomola
data.flavorText: It gently holds injured and weak Pokémon in its fins. Its special membrane heals their wounds.

attacks.name: Aqua Slash
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.name: Growlithe
data.flavorText: It's very friendly and faithful to people. It will try to repel enemies by barking and biting.

attacks.name: Stoke
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Fire Energy cards and attach them to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Quaxly
data.flavorText: This Pokémon migrated to Paldea from distant lands long ago. The gel secreted by its feathers repels water and grime.

data.name: Cetoddle
data.flavorText: It lives in frigid regions in pods of five or so individuals. It loves the minerals found in snow and ice.

data.name: Magneton
data.flavorText: They're formed by several Magnemite linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.

attacks.name: Explosion
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 90 damage to itself.

data.name: Mareep
data.flavorText: Its fleece grows continually. In the summer, the fleece is fully shed, but it grows back in a week.

data.name: Pawmo
data.flavorText: Pawmo uses a unique fighting technique in which it uses its forepaws to strike foes and zap them with electricity from its paw pads simultaneously.

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Wattrel
data.flavorText: When its wings catch the wind, the bones within produce electricity. This Pokémon dives into the ocean, catching prey by electrocuting them.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.name: Hypno
data.flavorText: Always holding a pendulum that it swings at a steady rhythm, it causes drowsiness in anyone nearby.

attacks.name: Pendulum Influence
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose an attack from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon in play and use it as this attack.

data.name: Gardevoir ex
data.flavorText: It has a psychic power that enables it to distort the space around it and see into the future.
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Psychic Embrace
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn, you may attach a Basic Psychic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Psychic Pokémon. If you attached Energy to a Pokémon in this way, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon. You can't use this Ability on a Pokémon that would be Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Miracle Force
attacks.text: This Pokémon recovers from all Special Conditions.

data.name: Klefki
data.flavorText: In the past, noble families entrusted their vault keys to a Klefki. They passed the Klefki down through the generations, taking good care of it.

abilities.name: Mischievous Lock
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, Basic Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's) have no Abilities, except for Mischievous Lock.

attacks.name: Joust
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard all Pokémon Tools from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Fidough
data.flavorText: This Pokémon is smooth and moist to the touch. Yeast in Fidough's breath induces fermentation in the Pokémon's vicinity.

attacks.name: Springy
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Florges
data.flavorText: They say that flower gardens created by Florges are constantly showered with a power that can heal both body and spirit.

abilities.name: Blooming Garden
abilities.text: Your Pokémon in play have no Weakness.

attacks.name: Moonblast
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks do 30 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Flittle
data.flavorText: Flittle's toes levitate about half an inch above the ground because of the psychic power emitted from the frills on the Pokémon's belly.

data.name: Floette
data.flavorText: This Pokémon uses red wavelengths of light to pour its own energy into flowers and draw forth their latent potential.

attacks.name: Magical Leaf
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage, and heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Houndstone
data.flavorText: A lovingly mourned Pokémon was reborn as Houndstone. It doesn't like anyone touching the protuberance atop its head.

attacks.name: Last Respects
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each Psychic Pokémon in your discard pile.

data.name: Mankey
data.flavorText: It is extremely quick to anger. It could be docile one moment, then thrashing away the next instant.

attacks.name: Monkey Beatdown
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Primeape
data.flavorText: Some researchers theorize that Primeape remains angry even when inside a Poké Ball.

attacks.name: Raging Punch
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

data.name: Riolu
data.flavorText: They communicate with one another using their auras. They are able to run all through the night.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

data.name: Lucario
data.flavorText: It's said that no foe can remain invisible to Lucario, since it can detect auras—even those of foes it could not otherwise see.

attacks.name: Avenging Knuckle
attacks.text: If any of your Fighting Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does 120 more damage.

attacks.name: Accelerating Stab
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Accelerating Stab.

data.name: Sandile
data.flavorText: It submerges itself in sand and moves as if swimming. This wise behavior keeps its enemies from finding it and maintains its temperature.

data.name: Great Tusk ex
data.flavorText: Klawf hangs upside-down from cliffs, waiting for prey. But Klawf can't remain in this position for long because its blood rushes to its head.
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Bedrock Breaker
attacks.text: Discard a Stadium in play.

attacks.name: Gigantic Tusks
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 50 damage to itself.

data.name: Klawf
data.flavorText: Klawf hangs upside-down from cliffs, waiting for prey. But Klawf can't remain in this position for long because its blood rushes to its head.

attacks.name: Adrenaline Hammer
attacks.text: This Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Pawniard
data.flavorText: Pawniard will fearlessly challenge even powerful foes. In a pinch, it will cling to opponents and pierce them with the blades all over its body.

data.name: Bisharp
data.flavorText: This Pokémon commands a group of several Pawniard. Groups that are defeated in territorial disputes are absorbed by the winning side.

attacks.name: Double-Edged Slash
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Forretress
data.flavorText: Its entire body is shielded by a steel-hard shell. What lurks inside this shell is a total mystery.

attacks.name: Continuous Spin
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 50 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Rolling Shell
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 50 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Bombirdier
data.flavorText: Bombirdier uses the apron on its chest to bundle up food, which it carries back to its nest. It enjoys dropping things that make loud noises.

attacks.name: Knickknack Carrying
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Pokémon Tool cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Clutch
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

data.name: Varoom
data.flavorText: It is said that this Pokémon was born when an unknown poison Pokémon entered and inspirited an engine left at a scrap-processing factory.

attacks.name: Poison Gas
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Varoom
data.flavorText: It is said that this Pokémon was born when an unknown poison Pokémon entered and inspirited an engine left at a scrap-processing factory.

data.name: Zangoose
data.flavorText: It's Seviper's archrival. To threaten those it encounters, it fans out the claws on its front paws.

attacks.name: Drag Off
attacks.text: Switch in 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon to the Active Spot. This attack does 30 damage to the new Active Pokémon.

data.name: Cacturne
data.flavorText: Packs of them follow travelers through the desert until the travelers can no longer move.

abilities.name: Counterattack Quills
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokémon (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 3 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

data.name: Sprigatito
data.flavorText: Its fluffy fur is similar in composition to plants. This Pokémon frequently washes its face to keep it from drying out.

data.name: Tarountula
data.flavorText: The thread it secretes from its rear is as strong as wire. The secret behind the thread's strength is the topic of ongoing research.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Spidops ex
data.flavorText: The thread it secretes from its rear is as strong as wire. The secret behind the thread's strength is the topic of ongoing research.
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Trap Territory
abilities.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost is Colorless more.

attacks.name: Wire Hang
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

data.name: Toedscool
data.flavorText: Though it looks like Tentacool, Toedscool is a completely different species. Its legs may be thin, but it can run at a speed of 30 mph.

attacks.name: Furious Kicks
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

data.name: Cacnea
data.flavorText: It prefers harsh environments, such as deserts. It can survive for 30 days on water stored in its body.

abilities.name: Counterattack Quills
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokémon (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 3 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

data.name: Tarountula
data.flavorText: The thread it secretes from its rear is as strong as wire. The secret behind the thread's strength is the topic of ongoing research.

attacks.name: String Shot
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Dolliv
data.flavorText: Dolliv shares its tasty, fresh-scented oil with others. This species has coexisted with humans since times long gone.

attacks.name: Apply Oil
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if the Defending Pokémon tries to attack, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack doesn't happen.

data.name: Gyarados ex
data.flavorText: An underpowered, pathetic Pokémon. It may jump high on rare occasions but never more than seven feet.
rules: Tera: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).
Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Tyrannical Tail
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 180 more damage.

data.name: Wugtrio
data.flavorText: It has a vicious temperament, contrary to what its appearance may suggest. It wraps its long bodies around prey, then drags the prey into its den.

attacks.name: Undersea Tunnel
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, discard the top 3 cards of your opponent's deck.

data.name: Skeledirge
data.flavorText: Skeledirge's gentle singing soothes the souls of all that hear it. It burns its enemies to a crisp with flames of over 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit.

attacks.name: Passionate Singing
attacks.text: Attach up to 2 Basic Energy cards from your discard pile to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Blazing Shout
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Growlithe
data.flavorText: It's very friendly and faithful to people. It will try to repel enemies by barking and biting.

attacks.name: Relentless Flames
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

data.name: Torkoal
data.flavorText: It burns coal inside its shell for energy. It blows out black soot if it is endangered.

attacks.name: Concentrated Fire
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 80 damage for each heads.

data.name: Floatzel
data.flavorText: With its flotation sac inflated, it can carry people on its back. It deflates the sac before it dives.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Magikarp
data.flavorText: An underpowered, pathetic Pokémon. It may jump high on rare occasions but never more than seven feet.

attacks.name: Jump
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Dondozo
data.flavorText: This Pokémon is a glutton, but it's bad at getting food. It teams up with a Tatsugiri to catch prey.

attacks.name: Release Rage
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each Tatsugiri in your discard pile.

data.name: Tatsugiri
data.flavorText: This is a small dragon Pokémon. It lives inside the mouth of Dondozo to protect itself from enemies on the outside.

attacks.name: Mise en Place
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Water Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Basic Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Curl Up
attacks.text: Put this Pokémon and all attached cards into your hand.

data.name: Wattrel
data.flavorText: When its wings catch the wind, the bones within produce electricity. This Pokémon dives into the ocean, catching prey by electrocuting them.

data.name: Dedenne
data.flavorText: It's small and its electricity-generating organ is not fully developed, so it uses its tail to absorb electricity from people's homes and charge itself.

attacks.name: Energy Munch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Kirlia
data.flavorText: It has a psychic power that enables it to distort the space around it and see into the future.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Drifloon
data.flavorText: It is whispered that any child who mistakes Drifloon for a balloon and holds on to it could wind up missing.

attacks.name: Balloon Blast
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

data.name: Magnezone ex
data.flavorText: They're formed by several Magnemite linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Energy Crush
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each Energy attached to all of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Pulse Launcher
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Toxtricity
data.flavorText: The jolts of electricity it launches by violently strumming the protrusions on its chest easily exceed 15,000 volts.

attacks.name: Yank Away
attacks.text: Choose 2 random cards from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals those cards and shuffles them into their deck.

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

data.name: Rotom
data.flavorText: Research continues on this Pokémon, which could be the power source of a unique motor.

attacks.name: Junk Hunt
attacks.text: Put an Item card from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Flittle
data.flavorText: Flittle's toes levitate about half an inch above the ground because of the psychic power emitted from the frills on the Pokémon's belly.

attacks.name: Dash Off
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Greavard
data.flavorText: This friendly Pokémon doesn't like being alone. Pay it even the slightest bit of attention, and it will follow you forever.

attacks.name: Underworld Stroll
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. Choose a Supporter card you find there and put it on the bottom of their deck.

data.name: Espathra
data.flavorText: It immobilizes opponents by bathing them in psychic power from its large eyes. Despite its appearance, it has a vicious temperament.

attacks.name: Eye Strength
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 50 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Hawlucha
data.flavorText: Its elegant finishing moves—performed by nimbly leaping around using its wings—are polished in the forest where it was born and raised.

abilities.name: Flying Entry
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may choose 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and put 1 damage counter on each of them.

data.name: Krokorok
data.flavorText: Protected by thin membranes, their eyes can see even in the dead of night. They live in groups of a few individuals.

attacks.name: Payback
attacks.text: If your opponent has exactly 1 Prize card remaining, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Koraidon ex
data.flavorText: This seems to be the Winged King mentioned in an old expedition journal. It was said to have split the land with its bare fists.
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Dino Cry
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may attach up to 2 Basic Fighting Energy cards from your discard pile to your Basic Fighting Pokémon in any way you like. If you use this Ability, your turn ends.

attacks.name: Wild Impact
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.name: Grimer
data.flavorText: Born from sludge, these Pokémon now gather in polluted places and increase the bacteria in their bodies.

attacks.name: Super Poison Breath
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Seviper
data.flavorText: It sharpens its swordlike tail on hard rocks. It hides in tall grass and strikes unwary prey with venomous fangs.

attacks.name: Spit Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Venoshock
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 120 more damage.

data.name: Spiritomb
data.flavorText: It was formed by uniting 108 spirits. It has been bound to the Odd Keystone to keep it from doing any mischief.

attacks.name: Taunt
attacks.text: Switch in 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon to the Active Spot.

attacks.name: Doom Decree
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is Knocked Out.

data.name: Toxicroak ex
data.flavorText: Inflating its poison sacs, it fills the area with an odd sound and hits flinching opponents with a poison jab.
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Nasty Plot
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Toxic Ripper
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. During Pokémon Checkup, put 6 damage counters on that Pokémon instead of 1.

data.name: Kingambit
data.flavorText: Only a Bisharp that stands above all others in its vast army can evolve into Kingambit.

abilities.name: Leadership
abilities.text: Your Basic Pokémon's attacks do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Mabosstiff
data.flavorText: Mabosstiff loves playing with children. Though usually gentle, it takes on an intimidating look when protecting its family.

abilities.name: Intimidating Howl
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may switch out your opponent's Active Pokémon to the Bench. (Your opponent chooses the new Active Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Wild Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Chansey
data.flavorText: It walks carefully to prevent its egg from breaking. However, it is extremely fast at running away.

attacks.name: Egg Rolling
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 60 damage for each heads.

data.name: Blissey
data.flavorText: The eggs it lays are filled with happiness. Eating even one bite will bring a smile to anyone.

abilities.name: Busybody Nurse
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may use this Ability. Your Active Pokémon recovers from all Special Conditions.

attacks.name: Happy Cyclone
attacks.text: Move all Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Starly
data.flavorText: They flock around mountains and fields, chasing after bug Pokémon. Their singing is noisy and annoying.

data.name: Skwovet
data.flavorText: No matter how much it stuffs its belly with food, it is always anxious about getting hungry again. So, it stashes berries in its cheeks and tail.

abilities.name: Nest Stash
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may shuffle your hand and put it on the bottom of your deck. If you put any cards on the bottom of your deck in this way, draw a card.

data.name: Meowscarada
data.flavorText: This Pokémon uses the reflective fur lining its cape to camouflage the stem of its flower, creating the illusion that the flower is floating.

attacks.name: Trick Cape
attacks.text: You may put an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon into their hand.

data.name: Tarountula
data.flavorText: The ball of threads wrapped around its body is elastic enough to deflect the scythes of Scyther, this Pokémon's natural enemy.

attacks.name: String Haul
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, switch in 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon to the Active Spot.

data.name: Smoliv
data.flavorText: It protects itself from enemies by emitting oil from the fruit on its head. This oil is bitter and astringent enough to make someone flinch.

data.name: Breloom
data.flavorText: It scatters poisonous spores and throws powerful punches while its foe is hampered by inhaled spores.

data.name: Floragato
data.flavorText: Floragato deftly wields the vine hidden beneath its long fur, slamming the hard flower bud against its opponents.

data.name: Toedscool
data.flavorText: Though it looks like Tentacool, Toedscool is a completely different species. Its legs may be thin, but it can run at a speed of 30 mph.

attacks.name: Spore
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Cetoddle
data.flavorText: It lives in frigid regions in pods of five or so individuals. It loves the minerals found in snow and ice.

data.name: Charcadet
data.flavorText: Burnt charcoal came to life and became a Pokémon. Possessing a fiery fighting spirit, Charcadet will battle even tough opponents.

data.name: Buizel
data.flavorText: It spins its two tails like a screw to propel itself through water. The tails also slice clinging seaweed.

data.name: Cetitan
data.flavorText: Ice energy builds up in the horn on its upper jaw, causing the horn to reach cryogenic temperatures that freeze its surroundings.

attacks.name: Sweeping Tackle
attacks.text: This attack does 20 less damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

data.name: Quaxwell
data.flavorText: These Pokémon constantly run through shallow waters to train their legs, then compete with each other to see which of them kicks most gracefully.

data.name: Capsakid
data.flavorText: Traditional Paldean dishes can be extremely spicy because they include the shed front teeth of Capsakid among their ingredients.

attacks.name: Slightly Spicy
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Charcadet
data.flavorText: Burnt charcoal came to life and became a Pokémon. Possessing a fiery fighting spirit, Charcadet will battle even tough opponents.

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Slowbro
data.flavorText: If the tail-biting Shellder is thrown off in a harsh battle, this Pokémon reverts to being an ordinary Slowpoke.

abilities.name: Strange Behavior
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn, you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your other Pokémon to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Bubble Drain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Houndour
data.flavorText: It uses different kinds of cries for communicating with others of its kind and for pursuing its prey.

data.name: Magnemite
data.flavorText: It moves while constantly hovering. It discharges electromagnetic waves and so on from the units at its sides.

attacks.name: Magnetic Switch
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Pawmot
data.flavorText: Pawmot's fluffy fur acts as a battery. It can store the same amount of electricity as an electric car.

abilities.name: Electrogenesis
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may search your deck for a Basic Lightning Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Electro Paws
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Miraidon
data.flavorText: Much remains unknown about this creature. It resembles Cyclizar, but it is far more ruthless and powerful.

attacks.name: Lightning Laser
attacks.text: This attack also does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Drowzee
data.flavorText: When it twitches its nose, it can tell where someone is sleeping and what that person is dreaming about.

attacks.name: Forced Sleep
attacks.text: Your opponent chooses 1 of their Benched Pokémon and switches it with their Active Pokémon. The new Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Ralts
data.flavorText: The horns on its head provide a strong power that enables it to sense people's emotions.

data.name: Fidough
data.flavorText: This Pokémon is smooth and moist to the touch. Yeast in Fidough's breath induces fermentation in the Pokémon's vicinity.

data.name: Flittle
data.flavorText: Flittle's toes levitate about half an inch above the ground because of the psychic power emitted from the frills on the Pokémon's belly.

data.name: Drifblim
data.flavorText: It can generate and release gas within its body. That's how it can control the altitude of its drift.

attacks.name: Curse Spreading
attacks.text: Put 8 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

data.name: Flabébé
data.flavorText: This Flabébé rides a red flower. Immediately after birth, this Pokémon begins flying around in search of a flower it likes.

data.name: Flaaffy
data.flavorText: Because of its rubbery, electricity-resistant skin, it can store lots of electricity in its fur.

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Toxel
data.flavorText: This selfish, attention-seeking Pokémon stores poison and electricity in two different sacs inside its body.

data.name: Pawmi
data.flavorText: The pads of its paws are electricity-discharging organs. Pawmi fires electricity from its forepaws while standing unsteadily on its hind legs.

data.name: Pachirisu
data.flavorText: A pair may be seen rubbing their cheek pouches together in an effort to share stored electricity.

abilities.name: Electricity Pouches
abilities.text: This Pokémon can't be Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Everyone Discharge
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each of your Benched Lightning Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness.

data.name: Dachsbun
data.flavorText: The pleasant aroma that emanates from this Pokémon's body helps wheat grow, so Dachsbun has been treasured by farming villages.

abilities.name: Well-Baked Body
abilities.text: This Pokémon can't be Burned. Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Fire Pokémon.

data.name: Meditite
data.flavorText: It never skips its daily yoga training. It heightens its inner strength through meditation.

attacks.name: Feint
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.name: Silicobra
data.flavorText: Silicobra's neck pouch, which can inflate and deflate like a balloon, gets more elastic each time Silicobra sheds its skin.

data.name: Sandaconda
data.flavorText: It will expand its body as much as it can and then contract itself, blasting out sand with enough force to wash away a dump truck.

attacks.name: Sandstorm Spray
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon. If you discarded any Energy in this way, your opponent shuffles their Active Pokémon and all attached cards into their deck.

data.name: Koraidon
data.flavorText: This seems to be the Winged King mentioned in an old expedition journal. It was said to have split the land with its bare fists.

attacks.name: Rampaging Fang
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Muk
data.flavorText: It's thickly covered with a filthy, vile sludge. It is so toxic, even its footprints contain poison.

abilities.name: Poison Sacs
abilities.text: Your opponent's Poisoned Pokémon don't recover from that Special Condition when they evolve or devolve.

attacks.name: Toxic Strike
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Croagunk
data.flavorText: Inflating its poison sacs, it fills the area with an odd sound and hits flinching opponents with a poison jab.

data.name: Maschiff
data.flavorText: Its well-developed jaw and fangs are strong enough to crunch through boulders, and its thick fat makes for an excellent defense.

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Revavroom
data.flavorText: It creates a gas out of poison and minerals from rocks. It then detonates the gas in its cylinders— now numbering eight—to generate energy.

abilities.name: Rumbling Engine
abilities.text: You must discard an Energy card from your hand in order to use this Ability. Once during your turn, you may draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Knock Away
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Zangoose
data.flavorText: The eggs it lays are filled with happiness. Eating even one bite will bring a smile to anyone.

data.name: Scatterbug
data.flavorText: This Pokémon scatters poisonous powder to repel enemies. It will eat different plants depending on where it lives.

abilities.name: Adaptive Evolution
abilities.text: This Pokémon can evolve during your first turn or the turn you play it.

data.name: Smoliv
data.flavorText: It protects itself from enemies by emitting oil from the fruit on its head. This oil is bitter and astringent enough to make someone flinch.

attacks.name: Nutrients
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

data.name: Heracross
data.flavorText: With its herculean powers, it can easily throw around an object that is 100 times its own weight.

attacks.name: Superpowered Throw
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

data.name: Tropius
data.flavorText: It lives in tropical jungles. The bunch of fruit around its neck is delicious. The fruit grows twice a year.

attacks.name: Fresh-Picked Fruit
attacks.text: Heal 60 damage from 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Skiddo
data.flavorText: Until recently, people living in the mountains would ride on the back of these Pokémon to traverse the mountain paths.

data.name: Shroomish
data.flavorText: It prefers damp places. By day it remains still in the forest shade. It releases toxic powder from its head.

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It grinds its teeth with great force to stimulate its brain. It fires the psychic energy created by this process from the protuberance on its head.

data.flavorText: The valve in Crocalor's flame sac is closely connected to its vocal cords. This Pokémon utters a guttural cry as it spews flames every which way.

attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.
